alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Carroll; Strafford (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 27 at 6:15PM EST until February 27 at 7:15PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Gray Maine has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northwestern Waldo County in south central Maine... Southern Oxford County in western Maine... Androscoggin County in southwestern Maine... Southeastern Somerset County in west central Maine... Southeastern Franklin County in western Maine... Kennebec County in south central Maine... Northwestern Knox County in south central Maine... York County in southwestern Maine... Lincoln County in south central Maine... Cumberland County in southwestern Maine... Sagadahoc County in south central Maine... Central Strafford County in central New Hampshire... Northeastern Belknap County in central New Hampshire... Carroll County in northern New Hampshire... * Until 715 PM EST. * At 614 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Farmington to Hiram to near Moultonborough, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes the following highways... Interstate 295 between mile markers 1 and 51. Interstate 95 between mile markers 15 and 156. Locations impacted include... Portland, Lewiston, Rochester, South Portland, Biddeford, Brunswick, Augusta, Westbrook, Waterville, Conway, Bath, Farmington, Fairfield, Gardiner, Bridgton, Fryeburg, Mechanic Falls, Alfred, Damariscotta and Sanford. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Temperatures are above freezing, but sharply colder temperatures following the snow will cause any water or slush to quickly freeze on roads and sidewalks. Untreated road surfaces will become extremely slippery. Reduced speeds and increased distance between vechicles is advised.
